TITLE.P: A 4 year framework for system development (primarliy post award management) and continued licensing, hosting and support

SHORT_DESCR.P: GEMS has been successfully deployed to support the online submission of all grant applications, the peer review and selection process, the finalisation of contracts and management of award payments and refunds. Now looking to:

1. support enhanced capture and reporting capability of contact details and staff positions, in order to stratify contacts for reporting, include ORCID number for future verification, and facilitate capture and reporting on professional background, gender and demographics
2. support the online submission of annual and final annual reports on active awards
3. support online submission, assessment and resolution of contract variation requests
4. support automation and further financial management functionality, and integration with other HRB financial management systems
5. enhance the ability of the HRB to generate a range of reports from the GEMS system that are not currently available

Since 2012 the Health Research Board (HRB) has worked with CC Technology to refine and customise their CC Grant Tracker software to deliver a centralised, integrated, secure and user-friendly solution for all aspects of grant management. To date, the system (entitled GEMS) has been successfully deployed to support the online submission of all grant applications, the peer review and selection process, the finalisation of contracts and management of award payments and refunds. The HRB now plans a second phase customisation and refinement of the GEMS system to deliver further post-award grant management functionality to:

1. support enhanced capture and reporting capability of contact details and staff positions, in order to stratify contacts for reporting, include ORCID number for future verification, and facilitate capture and reporting on professional background, gender and demographics
2. support the online submission of annual and final annual reports on active awards
3. support online submission, assessment and resolution of contract variation requests
4. support automation and further financial management functionality, and integration with other HRB financial management systems
5. enhance the ability of the HRB to generate a range of reports from the GEMS system that are not currently available
Also the licensing, hosting and support of the system over the next four years.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The works/goods/services can be provided only by a particular tenderer for reasons that are:

TITLE.P: A second phase customisation and refinement of the GEMS system to deliver further post-award grant management functionality

INFO_ADD.P: It should be noted that the value of the contract is an estimate only — but we do not expect it to exceed the amounts stated.
The contract can only be performed by CC Technology because the contract requires both interoperability with the current solution and further development by CC Technology who own the software.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.ADDRESS: Four Courts, Ground Floor (East Wing), Inns Quay

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: As set out in S.I. Nº 131/2010 European communities (Award of contracts by utilities undertakings) (Review procedures) Regulations 2010 (in particular Regulation 7 thereof).
